text: Greenlee County is a county found in the southeastern part of the U.S. state of Arizona. As of the 2020 census its population was 9,563, making it the least populous county in Arizona. The county seat is Clifton. ==History== The county was founded in 1909. The land was taken from nearby Graham County. It was named for Mason Greenlee. He was an early settler in the area. It was Arizona's 14th county. == Other websites == \- County website (only available for US residents) == References == Category:Arizona counties Category:20th- century establishments in Arizona Category:1909 establishments in the United States
title: Greenlee County, Arizona
